news_header: Protests erupted during the Spanish royal visit to flood-affected Valencia, while various global incidents highlight political unrest and natural disasters.
news_text: During a visit to flood-hit Valencia, the King and Queen of Spain faced protests where mud and objects were thrown at them, leading to an emotional moment for Queen Letizia. Meanwhile, in Georgia, the government secured nearly 54% of the election vote amid claims of irregularities. In Russia, President Putin held a news conference post-summit, while a Turkish attack resulted in five deaths. A trial involving Gisèle Pelicot and her ex-husband drew attention, and a Russian whale watcher was found alive after two months. Storms and floods have caused significant damage and loss of life across Europe, with emergency services responding to various crises.
